content:
Not sure how to make a multi realm server that can do the following.
x.zulip.domain.org -> only users in LDAP OU for x org unit can login
y.zulip.domain.org -> only users in LDAP OU for y org unit can login.
Currently it allows users from x and y org unit to login to any realm on the server.

@Tyson Parker Yeah, that's not implemented - this is issue https://github.com/zulip/zulip/issues/852 It's possible to get it working with some modifications to use django-auth-ldap's multiconfig as Tim indicated in https://github.com/zulip/zulip/issues/852#issuecomment-475041461 if you're willing to fiddle with it - but it's probably not the simplest thing
Thanks @Mateusz Mandera , I thought that may be the case. I'm going to just cross my fingers and hope everyone is well behaved rather than introduce another complexity.
Tyson Parker has marked this topic as resolved.

@Tyson Parker If you can set an additional attribute in the LDAP scheme (for every user) you can use https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/production/authentication-methods.html#restricting-ldap-user-access-to-specific-organizations
